intro: Spryginia afghanica, commonly known as the Afghan spryginia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Afghanistan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its botanical significance lies in its limited distribution and potential ecological role in its native habitat. Due to its rarity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
